description: From Old French divers, from Latin diversus (“various, different”), also written divorsus, past participle of diverto, divortere (“to turn or go different ways, part, separate, divert”); see divert.

adjectives.description: diverse (comparative more diverse, superlative most diverse)

entries.meaning: Consisting of many different elements; various.
Different; dissimilar; distinct; not the same

examples: Eloquence is a great and diverse thing.

entries.meaning: Composed of people with a variety of different demographic characteristics in terms of, for example, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, socioeconomic status, etc., and having a sizeable representation of people that are minorities in a given area.

examples: The Board’s goal is to commit to doubling the number of women and diverse members of the Academy by 2020.

adverbs.description: diverse (comparative more diverse, superlative most diverse)
